ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: This is only what the previous peoples did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: This is just a habit of antiquated people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This has been happening all along.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: your preaching is nothing but ancient legends and we shall not face any torment".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “This is nothing but the tradition of former people.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: This is no other than Khuluq of the ancients,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: This is naught but a custom of the ancients;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: this is nothing but the habit of the ancients,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: This is but a fable of the men of old,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: this is nothing but a habit of the ancients:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: This in but a custom of the ancients.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: These are nothing but the traditions of the ancients,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: This is no other than a customary device of the ancients,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: This is no other than the false-tales and religion of the ancients, [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 19, Page 97]
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: That is nothing but a habit of the ancients,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: This is nothing but morals of the ancients.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:137] This, that you threaten us with, is merely the fabrication of the ancients, that is, their inventions and lies (a variant reading [for khalq, ‘fabrication’] is khuluq, ‘ethos’, in other words, this denial of resurrection to which we adhere is merely ‘the ethos of the ancients’, in other words, their nature and wont);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (This) that in which we are now (is but a fable of the men of old) the religion of the people of old; the religion of our forefathers; it is also said that this means: what you say is nothing but the invention of the people of old,
